attributes.additional_details:
To reduce fatigue and burn-out amongst NHS staff 
To reduce staff sickness and improve health and wellbeing 
To improve patient safety 
To improve staff retention 
To improve staff recruitment
attributes.background: NHS staff working 12.5 hour shifts are currently not paid for breaks. This means that we end up working an extra shift per month to make up full time hours. This means that over the month we work 162.5 hours, but are only paid for 149.5 hours. Not to mention we often do not get our breaks.

rejection.details:
Pay and conditions for NHS staff are a matter for them, the NHS, and the relevant trade union(s), not the UK Government. 

You could have petition calling for a ban on unpaid breaks, if that is something you'd like to see happen.
